description: This operation retrieves the certification issuers that are currently defined.
This operation retrieves the certifications that are currently defined.
This operation allows the getting of ~Check-In~ ~Topics~
This operation allows the getting of ~Check-In~
This operation retrieves the Competencies currently defined.
Get all competency categories
This operation retrieves the educational degrees that are currently defined.

Exports all in-progress and completed employee reviews for all workers. Also allows                  exporting an employee review specified by WID or Reference ID. Results returned validate                  security for all workers.
This operation allows the getting of Feedback Badges.
Retrieves all feedback questions or only those specified by the Reference ID.
This operation will get the Field of Studies currently defined.
This operation allows the getting of Payout Bands
Task to export all ~Goal~ Units from the tenant.
Retrieves existing Goals for an organization. Results returned validate security for                  all workers.
Allows exporting all Review Question Categories from the tenant or Review Question                  Categories by reference ID or WID.
Get all Review Questions or only those specified by Reference ID from the tenant.
Task to export all Review Types from the tenant.
This operation retrieves the Educational Institution Types that are currently defined;
Get all skill source precedences

This operation gets updatable employee reviews for use with the Update Employee Reviews                  web service.  An updatable employee review must:                  1.  Have a manager evaluation.  In other words, the employee review must have reached                  the manager's inbox or has been submitted from the inbox.                  2. And an updatable employee review is either in progress or completed.                                    If your GET request does not find any updatable employee reviews, it will return all                  updatable employee reviews in the system.                                    The following request parameters are used to find the correct review to update: Employee                  Reference, Review Type Reference, Period Start Date, Period End Date.

Loads Employee Reviews from 3rd party systems for all review types. You must resolve                  all errors before data load. Evaluation events will be created for self, manager,                  and additional manager evaluation only if:                                    -Any component/item evaluation, section evaluation or overall section evaluation exist.                  -A workflow step is configured in the default Business Process definition for employee                  reviews.                                    Note: Workday does not evaluate condition rules on the business process definition                  to limit impact on performance.
Imports/loads the employee review information of a worker.
This operation allows adding a new worker goal and editing an existing goal for a                  worker.
This operation allows for adding and updating certifications.
This operation allows for adding and updating certification issuers.
Creates a new ~Check-In~ or updates an existing ~Check-In~ with the information supplied                  in the the request.
Creates a new ~Check-In~ ~Topic~ or updates an existing ~Check-In~ ~Topic~ with the                  information supplied in the the request.
This operation adds or updates a Competency.
Add/Update instances of competency category.
This operation adds or updates a Degree.
This web service task can be used to add, edit, and remove Feedback Badges.
Creates, updates, or deletes feedback questions. This web service is equivalent to                  the Manage Feedback Questions task in Workday.
This operation adds or updates a Field Of Study.
Creates a new ~Goal~ Payout Band (or updates an existing ~Goal~ Payout Band) with                  the information supplied in the request.
This web service task can be used to add, edit, and remove ~Goal~ Units.
This operation allows adding a new or editing an existing ~Goal~ for an Organization.
This web service task can be used to add, edit, and remove Review Questions.
This web service task can be used to add, edit, and remove Review Question Categories.
This web service task can be used to add, edit, and remove Review Types.
This operation adds or updates an Educational Institution Type.
Creates an in-progress or completed performance review for an employee. Enables entry                  of Overall Ratings and Comments for the employee self evaluation and manager evaluation.

Allows updating the manager’s rating inputs for an employee review, including Overall                  ratings and comments, Section ratings and comments, and Items ratings, comments and                  weights.                                    Supports all rating configurations for employee reviews.                                    The Override Overall Rating and Override Section Rating fields only apply to Ratings                  with Overrides configurations.                                    When you enable Ratings with Overrides or Calculated Ratings with Overrides in your                  template and you want to override ratings, set the Override Overall Rating or Override                  Section Rating fields to Yes. Otherwise Workday calculates the rating during processing.                                    When you enable Ratings without Overrides or Calculated Ratings with No Overrides,                  Workday ignores values entered in the Rating or Manager Section Rating fields, and                  in the Override Overall Rating and Override Section Rating fields. Instead Workday                  calculates the correct ratings based on item and section ratings.                                    The Manual Override column only applies to rating configurations of Manual Entry.                                    Workday uses these request parameters to find the correct review to update: Employee                  Reference, Review Type Reference, Period Start Date, and Period End Date.
